intro: Smyrnium nudicaule, commonly known as the slender cow-wheat, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbrella-like clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Smyrnium nudicaule is characterized by its lack of a basal rosette, with stems that are slender and often hairy.
